attributes.action: General Election called by Parliament, outcome needed before the 31st October.
attributes.additional_details:
Bank of England. EU withdrawal scenarios and monetary and financial stability: A response to the House of Commons Treasury Committee, November 2018
HMG. EU Exit: Long Term Economic Analysis. Cm 9742. November 2018. 
House of Commons Exiting the European Union Committee: The consequences of “No Deal” for UK business Fourteenth Report of Session 2017–19. HC 2560, 19th July 2019.
attributes.background: A No-Deal Brexit / leaving under WTO rules has severe consequences for the UK economy, Parliamentary democracy, the Union and the Northern Ireland Peace Agreement. A General Election ensures Parliamentary sovereignty remains paramount, and the electorate has its final say well before 31st October.
